div1.p: Bost thanks Carter for the doll and candy.

div1.head: Letter from Helen Bost to Henry Rose Carter, February 6, 1923
div1.opener:
mem-
letter in re
piece
Santa Claus reindeer
& the
Nebo, N. C.
Feb, 6. 1923.
My Dear Mr. Carter.
div1.p:
I have been
delayed in answering your kind
letter, received befor xmas.
I am sorry that I couldent
have answered befor now.
We were all sick with Flu
please pardon me for being so
long I talked about it every-day.
I thank you so much for
the Candy, and Baby- doll you
sent me. I cant express my
thanks to you for your kindness.
I think the doll was so pretty,
and the Candy was the best
I ever ate I gave my little
Brother's some of my candy
I was to stingy to give them
very much.

I tell every-body you are
kinder to me than my Father
is he wouldent gave me that
much. Maybe I can help you
some day, and if ever I can
I sure will be pleased to
death, I never will forget you
I was so sorry I was at school
the day you was at my house
if I had knew you was
coming that day beleave me I
would stayed at Home. Mamma
said she wished she could seen
you too her and Grand-mother,
send you their love and
best wishes for the new-year.
Grandmother all of us hopes we
will get to see you this summer
Tell your little I thank every
much for kindness picking out
my Baby- doll and I wish
I could get to see her.

I would like to know the next
time when you are coming
you know I would be at
home to see you.

I expect to keep the baby- doll's
as long as I live in rememer-
ance of you, and your little
daughter, I dont know her
name. I hope you-all are well
and enjoying your-selves fine.
It is sleeting today, to bad for us
to go to school, I wish you was
here today, you are so kind
please send me your girl's, and
your-self's picture would like
to hear from you again. I will
close for the time if you write
again I'll try and ans sooner.
div1.closer:
Your little girl Helen Bost.
Nebo, N. C. R. I.
